PostText: Dear Ms Generally speaking Supplemental Security Income SSI protected federal law SSI payments cannot levied garnished However case Circuit Court Appeals applies California found banks prevented intercepting incoming deposits Social Security SSI checks reimburse bank fees recover overdrafts case v Mutual th Cir held account agreement signed plaintiff amounted consent use Social Security SSI benefits meet overdraft obligations bank Accordingly court ruled banks seizure incoming Social Security SSI deposits constituted voluntary payment debt violate federal law California Supreme Court also ruled v Bank America state statute exempting Social Security SSI funds directly deposited bank account attachment prohibit bank seizing incoming SSI deposit repay overdrafts associated feesYour credit union therefore permitted intercept funds deposited SSI check cover amount overdrafted accountRegards

PostText: law recognizes two types hotels Transient Hotels Residential Hotels Residential Transient Hotels one another several basic ways type comes different legal rights obligations tenants owners Transient Hotel like typical services like maid room services phone services safe store valuables Occupants staying Transient Hotels generally seek temporary accommodations ie typical hotel guest hotel management seeks remove transient hotel guest nonpayment reason proceed outside restrictions Californias landlordtenant laws contrast Residential Hotel accommodates guests seek housing permanent semipermanent basis California defines Residential Hotel building containing six guestrooms primarily occupied persons use rooms primary residence Health Safety Code California state law exceptions resident becomes permanent resident continuous stay Civ Code Residential Hotel longterm guests substantial rights Californias landlordtenant laws exceptions longterm guests tenant rights would afforded tenant renting apartment lease CaliforniaIt would seem situation Homewood would likely qualify Residential Hotel category Since stayed hotel could considered permanent resident tenant therefore would right formal eviction proceeding However owner appear follow formal eviction process tenant pay rent due landlord give tenant notice pay rent quit notice informs tenant tenant three days pay rent full tenant pay rent landlord file eviction lawsuit court end three days Code Civ Proc tenant illegally evicted either sue landlord either civil court small claims court Whether tenant sues civil court small claims court tenant may recover following amounts actual damages outofpocket losses motel bills tenant find temporary place live landlord cut utility service punitive damages less tenant may also awarded court costs attorney feesHere link County SelfHelp Center httpwwwcourtscagovselfhelplhcshtml search free legal aid providers county go website Home LawhelpCA find Lawyer
